content.description: Stand start just right of the large rock half buried in the ground on a foot jug (A left palm press, or a crimpy right undercling may help). Use small iron features to dance your way up to 3 mm or 4 mm crystal crimps to the left. Then compress on some sloper pockets to stand up to the lip of the boulder and topout.
content.protection: One pad and some sticky rubber on your shoes.
content.location: This line goes straight up just right of the large rock half buried in the ground that is left of the large smooth crack in the middle of the slab face of The Cranny. A large fallen tree will help hold your pad in place.

content.description:
This problem is characterized by sparse holds up a tall, vertical face! Â The problem is can be distinguished by the perfect, vertical crimp seam about 10 feet up the wall.

Begin on crimps about head high. Once established, use a good right hand slot/pocket as well as other small features to move up and slightly left towards the vertical crimp seam. Following the vertical crimp seam, the only other distinct feature is a small slopey crimp about a foot from the top of the boulder. Once you stick the final crimp, set your feet up and make a somewhat committing hop to the top of the boulder!

The vertical crimp seam is slightly to the left of where the problem starts, the final small slopey crimp is slightly to the right.

If anyone has a suggestion for this problem, please let me know!
content.protection: Multiple pads!  Be sure to pad the slab behind you well!
content.location: The mostly blank slightly overhanging face about 10 feet from the end of the corridor (closest to the Romulus and Remus area).

content.description: An easy, but unique and very fun climb. Stand start smearing with both hands on the sloper jugs if the crescent feature. Use more jugs to work your way up and slightly right to the rock over the lip and topout. It is also a nice downclimb for the slabs at The Cranny.
content.location: This line goes straight up the sloping juggy crescent feature most of the way to the right on the slab wall of The Cranny.

content.description: Stand start on a foot jug and move up to the two obvious smooth crimps. Smear up to a jug shelf then follow more jug shelves up and over to topout.
content.protection: A pad for the pointy rocks.
content.location: This line goes straight up to a large rock at the lip of the slab wall of The Cranny. This line is about six feet right of the smooth sloping crack in the middle of the slab.
